alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 9:35PM EDT until May 24 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of piedmont North Carolina and western North Carolina, including the following counties, in piedmont North Carolina, Catawba, Cleveland and Lincoln. In western North Carolina, Burke and Caldwell. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers and embedded thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen and an additional inch of rain is possible through midnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory, Newton, St. Stephens, Conover, Longview, Icard, Hildebran, Belwood, Mountain View, Hickory Regional Airport, Lake Hickory, Propst, Cooksville, Vale, Startown and Northlakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
